name: Up-and-go breakfast muffins!
description: Recipe video above. No more dry, bland healthy muffins. These are healthy - but delicious!! Just 1 1/4 tsp of oil and 2 tsp honey per muffin, lower fat than usual sweet-treat muffins, refined sugar free and contain extra dietary fibre. Great for breakfast because it's not sweet like cake. But also morning tea - they are just sweet enough for me. :) Stays fresh for days.
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup coconut oil (, virgin or unrefined (normal oil also works but not as tasty, Note 1))
2/3 cup milk (, at room temperature - full fat best (low fat and non-dairy ok too))
1 1/4 cups wheat germ (best) (OR 1 1/4 cups (80g) wheat bran (Note 2))
1 1/2 cups wholemeal flour ((sub ordinary flour - Note 3))
1 tsp baking soda (, sifted if lumpy (or 3 tsp extra baking powder) - Note 4)
250g / 8 oz  raspberries (, 18 set aside and cut in half to decorate top if desired)
2 cups diced fresh fruit  ((not watery) - like apples, pears)
1 1/4 cups dried fruit, nuts, choc chips etc

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 190Â°C / 375Â°F (170Â°C fan). Line a 12 hole standard muffin tin with muffin cases OR spray generously with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 190Â°C / 375Â°F (170Â°C fan). Line a 12 hole standard muffin tin with muffin cases OR spray generously with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk wet - Place coconut oil in a microwave proof bowl. Microwave for 45 seconds on high or until melted. Add remaining Wet ingredients, whisk until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk wet - Place coconut oil in a microwave proof bowl. Microwave for 45 seconds on high or until melted. Add remaining Wet ingredients, whisk until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix in Dry - Sprinkle the Dry ingredients across the surface in the order listed. Mix just until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix in Dry - Sprinkle the Dry ingredients across the surface in the order listed. Mix just until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Raspberries - Gently stir in the whole raspberries or other add-ins of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Raspberries - Gently stir in the whole raspberries or other add-ins of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill muffin tin - Divide batter between the 12 holes using an ice cream scoop. Decorate top with halved raspberries.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill muffin tin - Divide batter between the 12 holes using an ice cream scoop. Decorate top with halved raspberries.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake 25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake 25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack.

review.reviewBody: So good! Taste exactly like Bowen Island and super easy to make. I split the batch in to blueberry and dark chop chip. Going to try white choc chip next time with some cacao ðŸ¤ž

These turned out so great. I added one mashed banana and reduced the honey content, frozen blueberries instead of raspberries, and used left over butter and olive oil instead of coconut oil. Really versatile and very moist.
These muffins are absolutely delish! My kids love them. They're perfectly moist and are a great healthy snack. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

I love these and make them regularly for taking to work for breakfast. I've recently had to go dairy free, so substitute 1/3 c homemade apple sauce for the yoghurt. I made these with dates, so reduce down the honey a bit to compensate for the sweetness.

Just made my third batch of these. I put callebaut dark choc chips and frozen raspberries in. Theyâ€™re delicious and filling. I normally struggle with breakfast, no matter what I eat - eggs, cereal, toast, etc. unless Iâ€™m at a buffet and eat EVERYTHING Iâ€™m starving an hour later. But with these Iâ€™m not! Game changer. Thanks again for another wonderful recipe Nagi!

I made these gluten free by subbing the same amount of brown flaxseed meal for the wheat germ, and the same amount of almond meal for the flour. I also added 1/4C coconut to make up for using refined coconut oil (didn't add any extra liquid as I used frozen raspberries). They turned out great!

I tried your up-and-go breakfast muffins first with dried apricots and they were a hit with everyone.
Today I used fresh Bing cherries, replaced cinnamon with nutmeg, and added some almond butter.
Phenomenal.

The perfect muffin does exist! I've made these three times in a couple of weeks using raspberries and a handful of white chocolate chips. They keep so well, stay moist, taste delicious and aren't too sweet. Perfection.

Could we please have the approx weight of the muffins, for the nutriton information?

Great recipe, kids and teens all loved it. I added dark choc chips as they were made for a snack rather than a meal replacement.

keywords: bran muffins, Breakfast Muffins, healthy muffins
